result.execSummary:
The defendant Xeng Khang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross. Bond on file applied.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

superMiscConds.notes: Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1.

records.addlTxt: of Conviction and Order - ERP /s/ TBE 10/16/17

1:44 p.m. Defendant Xeng Khang in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin and Atty Renc. Defendant Xeng Khang in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF317 and 16CF183 w/Atty Govin and 16CF444 w/Atty Renc. State requests 16CF444 is to be dismissed and read in. 

BTC: 16CF444 is DRI.
Parties have received and reviewed the PSI report. State makes sentencing recommendations. Atty Govin makes sentencing recommendations.
BTC: ***PRISON***
15CF317 Count 1: 
 3 yrs Incarceration and  4 yrs Extended Supervision
Eligible for the earned release/substance abuse
Not eligible for the challenge program
Conditions:
  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations if one recently done,   
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.  
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.
Pay costs and DNA surcharges.
Pay $430 drug buy monies reimbursement.
208 jail credit.
Any bonds shall be applied to fines, surcharges, and costs.

15CF317 Count 2:
3 yrs Incarceration and 4 yrs Extended Supervision, concurrent with count 1
Eligible for the earned release/substance abuse
Not eligible for the challenge program
Conditions:
Same conditions as Count 1.
Pay costs and DNA surcharges.

16CF183
2 yrs Incarceration and 2 yrs Extended Supervision, concurrent with 15CF317
Eligible for the earned release/substance abuse
Not eligible for the challenge program
Conditions:
Same conditions as 15CF317.
Pay costs and DNA surcharges.
Sentencing hearing on December 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

8:36 a.m. Defendant Xeng Khang in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin. ADA Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF317, 16CF183, 16CF231, 16CF238, and 16CF243.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:
15CF317 Count 1: Guilty
15CF317 Count 2: Guilty
16CF183: Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF317 Cts 1 & 2 and 16CF183.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CF317 Counts 3 & 4, 16CF231, 16CF238, 16CF243 are dismissed and read in.
 

BY THE COURT:***PSI Report ordered, provided to the Parties at least 1 week prior to the sentencing***  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Xeng Khang in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 16CF-183 and 15CF-317.

10:30 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

15CF-317 had been set for a plea, but in the interim Defendant picked up new charges.
State recommends that initial appearance be set on the new case, would waive prelim and set for pretrial, then to track all together.

Atty Govin concurs.

Address of Defendant is verified.

16CF-183:
Defense received a copy of complaint, waives reading.
Atty Govin went over the penalties and charges.
Defendant understood the penalties and charges.

Court has received the waiver of right to preliminary hearing.
Defendant signed the document today.
Defendant understands the purpose of the preliminary hearing.

Court questions Defendant on his waiver of preliminary hearing.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Court has received for filing the information.

Atty Govin received a copy of the information, waives reading and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY at this time.

BY THE COURT:
Bond previously set is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Cash bond amended from $25,000.00 to $5,000.00.

Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  2 times per week and comply with the rules.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Pauline LaBarge except for purposes of visitation with his child 
Defendant to reside with his father at 1910 Elm Street, Wisconsin Rapids, WI  54494.

Defendant Xeng Khang in court with attorney Stephen Michael Govin. Defendant Xeng Khang in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Set for Bond Modification Hearing today.

11:03 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Court has received the defendant's motion; Atty Govin makes additional statements.
Atty Govin provides updated address for the defendant if he was to be released and where he would be residing and does inform the Court that the defendant has become a new father so has additional ties to the community.
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court regarding a history of the defendant for failing to appear for Court dates and objects to the bond modification.
Court makes statements.
Atty Govin makes statements regarding employment of the defendant and additional issues.
Court questions the Attorney if the defendant would be able to get transportation to Stevens Point for Day Report; Atty Govin indicates that his family would be able to transport.
Atty Knaapen makes statements.
Atty Govin makes additional statements.
Court has concerns with the defendant going back to his drug using.
Atty Govin makes additional statements.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants the motion to reduce cash bond from $25,000.00 to $5,000.00.
Other conditions remain the same.
